HTML:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues‚Äîat all levels‚Äîwill invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won‚Äôt find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:

  • Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
  • A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You‚Äôll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
  • Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm‚Äôs diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
  • World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.

Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE‚Äôs core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients‚Äô most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call ‚ÄúIP development‚Äù) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics ‚Äì generally predictive or geospatial in nature ‚Äì to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact ‚Äì redefining what it means to provide the ‚Äúbest of the firm‚Äù to our clients. You‚Äôll work with McKinsey‚Äôs agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels. 02

Your Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as: data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
  • Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
  • Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
  • Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
  • Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
  • Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
  • Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills
  • Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
  • Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
  • Willingness to travel up to 50%
  • Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Support the Biocartis organization by performing data analysis needed for product development (assays, instruments, manufacturing line‚Ä¶), QC release and on market support
Support assay development teams by developing decision trees that will be integrated in assay specific software
Support assay development teams (internal and partner) with assay specific script development and writing
Support the assay development teams with respect to scientific software tools and data management.




Accountabilities

Develops tools and methods to facilitate analysis of the data generated during:
Assay Development
Cartridge production (including raw materials and semi-finished products)
Instrument production
Field usage
Develops the decision tree that will be integrated in the assay specific software
Writes assay specific software for our Idylla platform (LUA scripting, xml) in support of new assay development requirements of R&D and IVD. This includes definition of methods and data treatment algorithms and documentation.
Performs data mining tasks, statistical analyses and assist other project team members with these tasks
Keeps abreast of latest developments in bioinformatics tools to ensure state-of-the-art environment
Works as a member of a team, is responsible for organizing own time and resources in an optimal fashion. Prioritizes assigned projects and manages time accordingly. Is able to handle more than one project simultaneously
Provides planning input and estimations for their work to support the assay PM (project planning), functional lead and Bio IT manager (resource planning)
Works autonomously as a Bio IT lead for projects
Identifies improvement projects to make sure that the Bio-IT knowledge and capabilities stay in line with the Biocartis roadmap
Supports yearly R&D budget submission in line with general guidelines received, and recommend subsequent budget changes where necessary
Coaches Data Scientists from technical and process point of view
Applies industrialization and GxP expertise to build robust and reliable assays
Independent review of Bio IT related activities in technical and design review meetings




Profile requirements

Master in Bio-Informatics or Master in other life sciences discipline, Informatics, Applied Mathematics with experience in computational biology or equivalent through training/experience.
Basic knowledge of :

-Risk analysis and mitigation

-Controlled development according to planning, work instructions and procedures

Expert knowledge of:

-SW Development Lifecycle: planning, requirements, design, implementation, verification

-Assay industrialization and GxP

-Validation

-Agile Scrum

Biocartis specific :

-Expert knowledge of Idylla Platform (Console, Instrument, Cartridge, Idylla SW eco sphere, ...)

-Profound knowledge of ASSW development (TTP, MessagePack, DT, Reporting, ...)

-Expert knowledge of Biocartis QMS & SW Development standards

Expert knowledge of:

-Data visualization (Spotfire is a plus)

-Statistics

-Machine learning (classification, regression, ‚Ä¶)

-Deep Learning

-Science skills (Electronics, software, mechanics, chemistry, physics, optics, thermodynamics, fluids)

Programming skills such as:

-Scripting (LUA, Python)

-Mathematical programming ( R )

-Data analysis

Basic knowledge of:

-SQL query

-non-relational databases (Big data) is a plus

-Molecular Biology

Good communication skills:
Communicates with persuasion: presents, explains and defends a complex message in a clear and concise way and persuades different stakeholders
Planning & organization:
Time & priority management: plans activities effectively with respect for priorities and deadlines
Analytical thinking:
Conducts ongoing in-depth analyzis to anticipate potential problems and guides others in complex issues
Adaptable to change:
Accepts and implements change and adapts, even in difficult situations
Resilient:
Continues to perform effectively under time pressure and in the face of disappointment, adversity and opposition
PC skills:
General

-Expert knowledge of Spotfire

-Expert knowledge of IBM Synergy & Change, git, Team Foundation Server (TFS)

-Basic knowledge of (S)LIMS

Biocartis specific:

-Profound knowledge of Idylla Studio Library

-Expert knowledge of Idylla Studio

Legislation and regulation: Expert knowledge of applicable IVD legislation and standards (IVD, IEC62305, ISO13485, ccfr21part810,‚Ä¶)
Languages: Fluent in English both written and spoken, knowledge of Dutch is a plus




Our offering

We offer you a challenging job in an exciting environment, working for top entrepreneurs in the biotech industry. You can be part of a very dynamic, young and growing team in a highly innovative environment. You will have freedom to shape your work and shape your job. Your input is highly appreciated. Of course we offer you a fitting compensation package including a Flexible Income Plan and we care about your Wellbeing.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Freelance Chatbot Engineer ‚Äì Sports & Betting Analytics

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At The Stepstone Group, we have a simple yet very important mission: The right job for everyone. Join our team and you'll be responsible for our recommender systems and search algorithms, building the core infrastructure that powers millions of meaningful connections. Working in the Search & Match domain, you will be focusing on deploying and scaling machine learning models, particularly large language models (LLMs). You will collaborate with data scientists to make sure our models are efficient and can be properly optimized for cost and performance. You will work with software engineers to set up modern machine learning pipelines ensuring high operational standards. Title: Young Graduate AI Traineeship
Description:
Onze klant biedt op maat gemaakte talent development programs aan net afgestudeerden (of high potentials die reeds een eerste korte werkervaring hebben opgedaan) met als doel hen extra te trainen op soft- en hard skills zodat ze professioneel sterk kunnen groeien gedurende het tweejarig traject dat voor hen wordt uitgestippeld.




Momenteel hebben ze een samenwerking met een vooruitstrevende Belgische speler. De organisatie in kwestie is op zoek naar jonge professionals die zich willen toeleggen op AI-oplossingen om effici√´ntie en duurzaamheid te verbeteren.




Job Function




Als AI Trainee krijg je de kans om jouw AI-kennis in de praktijk te brengen en deze verder te ontwikkelen in een intens en leerzaam traject. Je zult actief bijdragen aan diverse projecten die steeds AI gericht zijn.




Naast de praktische ervaring die je zal opdoen tijdens de projecten wordt er doorheen dit traineeship ook veel belang gehecht aan de ontwikkeling van jouw soft skills zodat je als persoon verder kan groeien op professioneel vlak. Daarom worden er doorheen het twee jaar durende traineeship veel extra trainingen gegeven om bijvoorbeeld jouw leadership en andere soft skills verder aan te scherpen.




Kort samengevat, professionele en ervaren coaches zullen u persoonlijk begeleiden om uw soft skills en hard skills verder te ontwikkelen om zo uw carri√®re in een stroomversnelling te brengen.




Na afloop van het traineeship kan u vast aan de slag binnen de organisatie en zal u er meteen een belangrijke rol kunnen opnemen. Dit kan als expert of als leidinggevende.




Job Requirements




U behaalde een masterdiploma;
U heeft maximum 2 jaar werkervaring;
U bent gepassioneerd door AI en kan een eerste ervaring voorleggen (studies, cursus, project, ...);
U wil graag verder groeien op professioneel en persoonlijk vlak;
U beheerst volgende drie talen: Nederlands, Frans en Engels.




Job Offer




U ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket, maar bovenal zult u grondig getraind worden en zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak heel sterk groeien.
Tijdens dit intensief traineeship krijg je een mix van technische trainingen, praktische ervaring die je zal opbouwen, persoonlijke coaching en heel wat trainingen om jouw softskills verder te ontwikkelen.
Je zal in een innovatieve werkomgeving terechtkomen waarin technologie en AI de toekomst vormgeven.
Na afloop van dit traineeship krijg je een vast contract en zal je binnen de organisatie een belangrijke rol kunnen opnemen.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Remote - Europe or Asia)
Description:
Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

One of our partner companies is currently looking for a Senior Data Scientist - B2B based in Europe or Asia.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will join a distributed team focused on unlocking insights that power data-driven decisions for B2B initiatives. You'll work closely with other data scientists and engineers to explore user behavior, design impactful experiments, and develop strategic models that improve customer acquisition, retention, and product development. Your work will directly shape how professionals use digital tools at scale in a rapidly growing market segment. The team values autonomy, documentation, and async-first collaboration, with flexibility for remote work and timezone balance.

Accountabilities:


Analyze user behavior to uncover drivers of activation, engagement, churn, and upgrades
Lead experimentation efforts, including A/B test design and impact attribution
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to surface strategic insights and greenfield opportunities
Develop self-serve analytics tools, dashboards, and data literacy programs
Build and maintain predictive models and use case clustering solutions
Perform ETL tasks and model new data dimensions for strategic decision-making
Attribute product and marketing impact to core KPIs with statistical rigor



Requirements


6+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Python or R, and modern BI/analytics tools (e.g., dbt)
Expertise in statistical methods, experimentation design, and machine learning techniques
Proven experience analyzing large datasets to solve business problems
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain insights to non-technical audiences
Strong stakeholder management and ability to influence cross-functional teams
Passion for continuous learning, fast iteration, and working in a dynamic, async environment



Benefits


Meaningful equity in a profitable tech company
Flexible remote work with sponsored visits to regional offices (Hong Kong or London)
Annual company offsite (e.g., Portugal 2023, Bali 2024)
Comprehensive medical insurance for you and your dependents
Home office and wellness budget (equipment, training, etc.)
Flexible working hours and an async-first work culture



Jobgether hiring process disclaimer

This job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.

Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.

Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.

If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 days.

If you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experience.

Thank you for your interest!

Description:
About HireShire




HireShire is a modern staffing and talent acquisition platform helping leading organizations find exceptional talent. We‚Äôre now expanding into the Data & Analytics vertical and are looking for curious, driven, and analytical minds to join us as part of our Data Science Internship Cohort.




Role Overview




As a Data Science Intern at HireShire, you will collaborate with our engineering and strategy teams to design data-driven solutions that power smarter hiring, workforce planning, and operational decision-making. This is a hands-on role where you‚Äôll work on real business datasets to build production-ready analytics models and dashboards.




Key Responsibilities




Collect, clean, analyze, and transform structured & semi-structured HR and recruitment datasets
Build predictive models for talent forecasting, attrition risk, and candidate success scores
Develop data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Python, SQL & BI tools
Perform EDA (exploratory data analysis) to uncover insights that inform recruitment strategies
Work with time-series & cohort data for trend analysis and performance metrics
Deploy statistical and ML algorithms (regression, clustering, classification) in scalable pipelines
Communicate findings & recommendations with clear visual and written formats to stakeholders




Requirements




Pursuing (or recently completed) B.Tech/BE/M.Tech/MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields
Proficiency in Python + core libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib/Seaborn, Scikit-learn)
Familiarity with SQL for querying relational datasets
Sound understanding of ML fundamentals ‚Äì supervised/unsupervised learning methods
Strong statistics foundation ‚Äì distributions, hypothesis testing, probability
Ability to interpret data, derive insights, and present conclusions clearly
Strong communication skills, ownership mindset & enthusiasm to learn




Nice to Have (Bonus)




Knowledge of BI tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / Metabase)
Basics of cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) or Docker
Prior exposure to HR analytics or recruitment datasets




What You‚Äôll Get




Practical exposure to solving real-world data problems in HR Tech
Experience working on high-impact product features used by recruiters and hiring managers
1:1 mentorship by experienced data scientists and access to premium resources
Internship Certificate & Letter of Recommendation upon successful completion
Opportunity for a Pre-Placement Offer (PPO) at HireShire or client companies




Hiring Process




Online Application

Submit CV, GitHub/Kaggle links, and a brief note on your interest and experience

Technical Assessment

Assignment to test Python, SQL, EDA, or modeling approach

Technical Interview

In-depth discussion (45 mins) on your ML/stats understanding & problem-solving

Managerial Interview

Evaluate communication skills, culture fit & motivation

Offer

Selected applicants receive the internship offer with stipend details & project allocation

Onboarding

Orientation, project assignment & setup with tools and mentors




Stipend

Minimum stipend starts at 18 euro/hour, with the possibility of a higher rate based on performance in the interviews.

HireShire is a modern staffing and talent acquisition platform helping leading organizations find exceptional talent. We‚Äôre now expanding into the Data & Analytics vertical and are looking for curious, driven, and analytical minds to join us as part of our Data Science Internship Cohort.


Role Overview


As a Data Science Intern at HireShire, you will collaborate with our engineering and strategy teams to design data-driven solutions that power smarter hiring, workforce planning, and operational decision-making. This is a hands-on role where you‚Äôll work on real business datasets to build production-ready analytics models and dashboards.


Key Responsibilities


  • Collect, clean, analyze, and transform structured & semi-structured HR and recruitment datasets
  • Build predictive models for talent forecasting, attrition risk, and candidate success scores
  • Develop data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Python, SQL & BI tools
  • Perform EDA (exploratory data analysis) to uncover insights that inform recruitment strategies
  • Work with time-series & cohort data for trend analysis and performance metrics
  • Deploy statistical and ML algorithms (regression, clustering, classification) in scalable pipelines
  • Communicate findings & recommendations with clear visual and written formats to stakeholders


Requirements


  • Pursuing (or recently completed) B.Tech/BE/M.Tech/MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields
  • Proficiency in Python + core libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib/Seaborn, Scikit-learn)
  • Familiarity with SQL for querying relational datasets
  • Sound understanding of ML fundamentals ‚Äì supervised/unsupervised learning methods
  • Strong statistics foundation ‚Äì distributions, hypothesis testing, probability
  • Ability to interpret data, derive insights, and present conclusions clearly
  • Strong communication skills, ownership mindset & enthusiasm to learn


Nice to Have (Bonus)


  • Knowledge of BI tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / Metabase)
  • Basics of cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) or Docker
  • Prior exposure to HR analytics or recruitment datasets


What You‚Äôll Get


  • Practical exposure to solving real-world data problems in HR Tech
  • Experience working on high-impact product features used by recruiters and hiring managers
  • 1:1 mentorship by experienced data scientists and access to premium resources
  • Internship Certificate & Letter of Recommendation upon successful completion

Hiring Process


Online Application

  • Submit CV, GitHub/Kaggle links, and a brief note on your interest and experience

Technical Assessment

  • Assignment to test Python, SQL, EDA, or modeling approach

Technical Interview

  • In-depth discussion (45 mins) on your ML/stats understanding & problem-solving

Managerial Interview

  • Evaluate communication skills, culture fit & motivation

Offer

  • Selected applicants receive the internship offer with stipend details & project allocation

Onboarding

  • Orientation, project assignment & setup with tools and mentors


Stipend

Minimum stipend starts at 18 euro/hour, with the possibility of a higher rate based on performance in the interviews.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì Data Scientist

Functiebeschrijving

In het AI&Analytics Solutions team willen we ervoor zorgen dat we slimme besluitvorming (menselijke augmentatie of geautomatiseerd) naar de voorgrond brengen van onze processen/journeys door het opbouwen van een datas en experimentatiecultuur die uiteindelijk een concurrentievoordeel kan worden in de snel veranderende wereld van vandaag.

Heb je een passie voor het ontdekken van inzichten uit data en het omzetten hiervan in impactvolle oplossingen? Ben je enthousiast om zakelijke waarde uit data te halen?

Als Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist in ons team, zal je:


Nauw samenwerken met bedrijfsstakeholders om hun uitdagingen te begrijpen en te vertalen naar analytische problemen.
Machine learning, statistische methoden en optimalisatietechnieken toepassen om innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen die zakelijke impact hebben.
Voorspellende en prescriptieve modellen ontwerpen, bouwen en evalueren, en zorgen voor betrouwbaarheid en robuustheid.
Leiding nemen in de volledige lifecycle van ML-producten: van idee en prototyping tot implementatie en voortdurende evaluatie in productie.
Samenwerken met andere Data Scientists om kennis, best practices te delen en onze methodologie√´n continu te verbeteren.
Zorgen voor de kwaliteit en prestaties van je oplossingen door rigoureus testen en voortdurende monitoring na deployment.
Bijdragen aan onze data science community door herbruikbare assets te ontwikkelen, je expertise te delen en deel te nemen aan innovatie-initiatieven.


Profiel

Als Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì Data Scientist heb je:


Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist/ML Engineer of een vergelijkbare analytische rol.
Een masterdiploma in een relevant vakgebied (bijv. Toegepaste Wiskunde, Statistiek, Data Science, Natuurkunde, Informatica).
Sterke praktische kennis van machine learning, statistiek en optimalisatietechnieken, met hands-on ervaring in het toepassen ervan op echte problemen. Ervaring met het ontwikkelen, evalueren en implementeren van end-to-end data science oplossingen.
Vaardigheid in Python en gangbare data science libraries
Bekendheid met cloud computing omgevingen.
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe concepten uit te leggen aan zowel technische als niet-technische doelgroepen.
Vloeiend in Engels, evenals in French of Dutch


En je bent ook:


Gepassioneerd over het oplossen van zakelijke problemen met data en analytics.
Resultaatgericht, in staat om technische excellentie te combineren met zakelijke behoeften.
Nieuwsgierig en enthousiast om continu te leren en te experimenteren met nieuwe technieken.
Samenwerkingsgericht en gedijt in teamomgevingen.
Proactief, analytisch en oplossingsgericht.


AXA wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de diverse samenleving waarin wij leven en voert daarom al jaren een beleid van actieve diversiteit, non-discriminatie en gelijke kansen. In dit kader garanderen wij een gelijke behandeling en toegang tot selecties, ongeacht leeftijd, afkomst, culturele achtergrond, handicap, geslacht of seksuele geaardheid of andere kenmerken. Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af.

AXA Belgium

Meer dan 3000 mensen werken bij ons, vanuit onze vooruitstrevende kantoren in Brussel, Antwerpen, Eupen en Luik. We werken samen met 3200 makelaars. We hebben 3 miljoen klanten en zijn nummer 1 in autoverzekeringen. Het is onze ambitie om onze relatie met al onze klanten te transformeren van betaler naar partner om ons echt te onderscheiden.

Onze belangrijkste leidraad zijn onze waarden:‚ÄØCustomer first, Integrity, Courage‚ÄØen‚ÄØOne AXA. Alles wat we doen, daar staan we als √©√©n team achter.

Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af. Meer info in ons‚ÄØDiversiteits- en Inclusiebeleid.

Wat we aanbieden

Een mooie beloning voor je werk

Een competitief loon, eventueel aangevuld met discretionaire persoonlijke en collectieve premies en natuurlijk ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een volledige terugbetaling van het openbaar vervoer en een cafetariaplan.

Alle voordelen van werken bij een verzekeraar

Van groepsverzekering tot ambulante en hospitalisatieverzekering (ook gezinsleden kunnen daarbij aansluiten aan een voordelig tarief) en met tot 30% korting op onze andere verzekeringsproducten.‚ÄØ

Een job die zich aanpast aan je leven en dromen

Een flexibel rooster van 35 uur per week, 36 dagen verlof per jaar om op te laden, evenals de optie om thuis te werken, tot 3 dagen per week.

Wij bieden sportlessen op het werk, welzijnsprogramma's voor werknemers en trainingen, om u in topvorm te houden, zowel fysiek als mentaal.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
ü§ñ The Job

At Dataroots, we couple our excellent consulting services with our technical expertise to build advanced machine learning models to improve business processes across a variety of industries, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our in-house team of AI specialists, designing and implementing models that deliver robust, data-driven solutions for our clients.




Passionate about data, you enjoy diving deep to uncover actionable insights and develop machine learning models that enhance client operations. You‚Äôll experiment with different approaches, while collaborating with Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists to drive the delivery of tailored, high-quality, end-to-end solutions.




You‚Äôll also have the opportunity to mentor colleagues, share knowledge, and stay on top of industry developments through a range of initiatives we support internally.




üéâ What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees‚Äô career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




üíº What we‚Äôre looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

A deep passion for Machine Learning and a Master‚Äôs or PhD in a quantitative discipline.
Strong foundation in software design principles.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in machine learning and big data.
Expertise in machine learning and deep learning, with both a theoretical and practical grasp.
Proficiency in Python & SQL is a must; knowledge of R is an advantage.
Experience with deploying machine learning models and familiarity with MLOps practices.
At least a first experience with AWS, Azure or GCP and a solid understanding of cloud engineering and its use in Machine Learning.
Experience with ML versioning tooling.
Enthusiasm for working with large datasets and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complex technical concepts for clients.
Fluency in English and Dutch.




Don't worry if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement from the start. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




üí∞ The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you‚Äôll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




üìç Where you‚Äôll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




üéØ Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We‚Äôre looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! üéâ

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced AI Engineer with a Data Science background to join our professional services team of 50+ engineers. The position is available full-time, with part-time arrangements possible for the right candidate. This remote-first role focuses on Generative AI development, specifically building and deploying advanced Large Language Models (LLMs) and AI agents. You'll work with state-of-the-art foundation models through platforms like AWS Bedrock and GCP Vertex AI to develop innovative GenAI applications and scalable AI infrastructure for our clients.




Key Responsibilities:

Generative AI Development:

Design and implement production-ready generative AI applications and AI agents using foundation models and cutting-edge protocols like MCP and A2A
Fine-tune and optimize LLMs for specific use cases and domains
Create and maintain prompt engineering strategies and evaluation frameworks
Design and deploy autonomous AI agents with targeted capabilities




AI/ML Engineering:

Build end-to-end LLM pipelines for fine-tuning, deployment, and monitoring
Implement RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems
Create efficient vector storage and embedding solutions




Infrastructure and Operations:

Build and maintain robust AI infrastructure using AWS and GCP services
Implement monitoring systems for model performance and infrastructure health
Optimize cloud resources for cost-efficiency while maintaining performance




Preferred Qualifications:

4+ years of experience in AI, machine learning, or data science, with a recent focus on Generative AI
Strong programming skills and experience with LLM and Agent frameworks (LangChain, CrewAI)
Expertise in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) and containerization technologies
Deep understanding of LLM operations, including prompt engineering and RAG
Experience with vector databases and semantic search implementations
Experience building and deploying AI agents using modern frameworks
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities




Employment Options:

Full-time position (40 hours/week)
Part-time arrangements available for qualified candidates (minimum 20 hours/week)




Benefits:

Potential career paths include AI Team Lead
Collaborative remote team environment
Opportunity to contribute to open-source GenAI initiatives and research publications

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Are you a skilled ML Engineer ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in machine learning to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.

üî• Your Responsibilities:



Design, build, and train machine learning models to address complex business problems.
Fine-tune model performance through feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and validation techniques.
Develop pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to align model outcomes with strategic goals.
Stay up to date with emerging ML techniques and tools, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.



üéØ Your Profile:

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.



Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and model evaluation techniques.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
Experience with cloud-based ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML).
Proven track record in deploying machine learning models at scale.



üöÄ Advantages:



An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.



üí° We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
Show more
HTML:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues‚Äîat all levels‚Äîwill invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won‚Äôt find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You‚Äôll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm‚Äôs diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE‚Äôs core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients‚Äô most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call ‚ÄúIP development‚Äù) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics ‚Äì generally predictive or geospatial in nature ‚Äì to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact ‚Äì redefining what it means to provide the ‚Äúbest of the firm‚Äù to our clients. You‚Äôll work with McKinsey‚Äôs agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels. 02

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as: data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred
Show more

Title: AI & Machine Learning Engineering Consultant
Description:
Are you willing to make a step in your career and deliver AI solutions from early discovery stages up to industrialized solutions as part of large transformation projects? Are you willing to re-imagine the future of the industry, and the next generation of production process or supply chain control solutions? If this is the case, this role will be of interest to you!

Team



Working across industry groups, our Data & AI team combines deep technology, business and industry expertise to design and deliver some of the largest, most challenging and highest profile technology solutions in the world.

You'll work on innovative projects with colleagues to drive collaboration from strategy through to implementation. You will be using the latest technologies, with a particular focus on AI and GenAI, with clients to help them get to the next level.

You'll learn, grow and advance in an innovative culture that thrives on shared success, diverse ways of thinking and enables boundaryless opportunities that can drive your career in new and exciting ways

If you‚Äôre looking for a challenging career working in a vibrant environment with access to training and a global network of experts, this could be the role for you. As part of our team, you'll be working with cutting-edge technologies and will have the opportunity to develop a wide range of new skills on the job.

Your background will involve contributing across projects including software engineering, technology architecture solution implementation, product selection and application strategy definition, or the introduction of technology to drive business improvement into an operational organization.

Our team has the remit to operate in multiple industries, including Financial Services, Resources, Products, Communications and Health & Public Services.



Process



How to help clients to use AI/ML technologies to solve business challenges

How to design, develop, deploy, and run high quality AI/ML solutions across a range of industries with varying business and organizational challenges

The latest technology solutions from industry and how to apply them to solve real world customer problems

Design and build use-case and platform technology solutions to solve key business challenges using reference and cutting-edge technologies and engineering patterns

Work in multi-disciplinary teams to build complex solutions working from inception through to production and operations

Contribute to the technology strategy and solution design, managing and supporting other developers

Contribute to the Accenture Data & AI community, sharing insights and experience of using emerging technologies on client deliveries and through research



Your team

The Data and AI revolution is changing everything. It‚Äôs everywhere ‚Äì transforming how we work and play. Join Accenture and help transform leading organisations and communities around the world. Accenture Data and AI Science is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate with the ecosystem, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance.

Accenture‚Äôs Data and AI practice covers the range of Data and AI skills, from Strategy, Data Science, Data Architecture, AI Engineering and Visual Insights. When combined with Accenture‚Äôs broader Strategy and Consulting practice, we are able to bring together the unique ability to drive end to end business change through the application of Data and AI.

You'll learn, grow and advance in an innovative culture that thrives on shared success, diverse ways of thinking and enables boundaryless opportunities that can drive your career in new and exciting ways.

If you‚Äôre looking for a challenging career working in a vibrant environment with access to training and a global network of experts, this could be the role for you. As part of our global team, you'll be working with cutting-edge technologies and will have the opportunity to develop a wide range of new skills on the job.

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.

We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.

‚ÄúAcross the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.‚Äù ‚Äì Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO

Your background



AI/ML platform technologies and services such as Sagemaker/Vertex/Azure ML, OpenAI, Langchain, AutoML, OCR, STT, feature stores, vector DB, ‚Ä¶

Implementation of AI/ML architectural patterns and best practices e.g. data drift detection, experimentation tracking, RAG, deployment models

Building and using cloud-based solutions (networking, security, storage, monitoring, scaling, DR/HA, ‚Ä¶) on one or more cloud platforms

SW Engineering and DevSecOps

Fluent in English, in Dutch and/or in French



Bonus point if you‚Ä¶



Certified cloud Machine Learning.

Building PoCs to aid learning

Experience of delivering production AI/ML services for scaled end user consumption



Our offer

Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you‚Äôll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we‚Äôre really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture. We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.

We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.

Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:



13th month + holiday allowance

20 + 12 holidays

Laptop and smartphone

Hospitalization insurance and extensive group insurance package

Bonus program

Unique training & learning opportunities beyond your role specifics

Green mobility program: e-bikes, public transport, bike 2 work allowance,‚Ä¶

Flexrewards: decide on your rewards package with our flexible benefits tool

Discount program: get discounts at your favorite (online) shops

Employee shares purchase plan

Eco-cheques

And many more!

Title: Data Scientist - Banking
Description:
Who We Are

NORRIQ is an international organization headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to driving business transformation through innovative technology.

Our expanding Financial Services (FS) practice includes a team of 100+ specialists committed to helping banks and financial institutions adapt to evolving client demands, adopt cutting-edge technologies, and navigate complex regulatory environments.

At NORRIQ, we believe our people are our greatest asset. We cultivate a culture of innovation, growth, and excellence, offering tailored training, opportunities for advancement, and a strong sense of community. Join us on this remarkable journey and become a valued member of the NORRIQ family‚Äîconnected for life!

The Opportunity

NORRIQ FS is seeking a Senior/Medior Data Scientist to drive our data analytics and machine learning initiatives while delivering innovative solutions to our financial services clients.

Roles & Responsibilities

Client-Facing Responsibilities:


Design and implement machine learning solutions for complex business problems
Conduct exploratory data analysis and create insightful visualizations
Develop and maintain data pipelines for model deployment
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions
Provide technical guidance on data science best practices


Technical Responsibilities


Develop and maintain ML models using scikit-learn and other Python libraries
Implement version control for both code and data using GitLab and DVC
Create and maintain Jupyter notebooks for analysis and documentation
Ensure reproducibility of data science workflows
Optimize existing models and data pipelines for improved performance
Follow ML ops best practices for model deployment and monitoring


Internal Contributions


Contribute to NORRIQ's data science expertise through knowledge sharing
Participate in proposal writing and solution architecture
Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance
Stay current with latest developments in data science and ML


Your Profile

Experience : 2-6 years in the following areas:


Professional experience as a data scientist or ML engineer
Proven track record of implementing ML solutions in production
Experience with financial services industry preferred
Strong background in statistical analysis and machine learning


Technical Skills


Expert in Python programming and data science libraries
Proficiency with scikit-learn, pandas, and numpy
Experience with version control (GitLab) and DVC
Strong knowledge of Jupyter Lab and notebook-based development
Understanding of ML ops and deployment practices
Experience with SQL and data manipulation
Education: Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Languages: Fluency in English, and Dutch or French, with at least passive knowledge of the other


What NORRIQ Offers You


Be part of a fast-growing, international organization with a unique and people-centered culture
Enjoy a highly competitive compensation package, including a company car, iPhone, and additional allowances
Access extensive training programs in Belgium and Denmark, focusing on both technical expertise and soft skills
Work with a dynamic and diverse team of experienced professionals and young talent in a collaborative environment within the financial services sector


Join NORRIQ to elevate your career, contribute to transformative projects, and make a lasting impact in the financial services industry!

Who We Are

NORRIQ is an international organization headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to driving business transformation through innovative technology.

Our expanding Financial Services (FS) practice includes a team of 100+ specialists committed to helping banks and financial institutions adapt to evolving client demands, adopt cutting-edge technologies, and navigate complex regulatory environments.

At NORRIQ, we believe our people are our greatest asset. We cultivate a culture of innovation, growth, and excellence, offering tailored training, opportunities for advancement, and a strong sense of community. Join us on this remarkable journey and become a valued member of the NORRIQ family‚Äîconnected for life!

The Opportunity

NORRIQ FS is seeking a Senior/Medior Data Scientist to drive our data analytics and machine learning initiatives while delivering innovative solutions to our financial services clients.

Roles & Responsibilities

Client-Facing Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement machine learning solutions for complex business problems
  • Conduct exploratory data analysis and create insightful visualizations
  • Develop and maintain data pipelines for model deployment
  • Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions
  • Provide technical guidance on data science best practices

Technical Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain ML models using scikit-learn and other Python libraries
  • Implement version control for both code and data using GitLab and DVC
  • Create and maintain Jupyter notebooks for analysis and documentation
  • Ensure reproducibility of data science workflows
  • Optimize existing models and data pipelines for improved performance
  • Follow ML ops best practices for model deployment and monitoring

Internal Contributions

  • Contribute to NORRIQ's data science expertise through knowledge sharing
  • Participate in proposal writing and solution architecture
  • Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance
  • Stay current with latest developments in data science and ML

Your Profile

Experience : 2-6 years in the following areas:

  • Professional experience as a data scientist or ML engineer
  • Proven track record of implementing ML solutions in production
  • Experience with financial services industry preferred
  • Strong background in statistical analysis and machine learning

Technical Skills

  • Expert in Python programming and data science libraries
  • Proficiency with scikit-learn, pandas, and numpy
  • Experience with version control (GitLab) and DVC
  • Strong knowledge of Jupyter Lab and notebook-based development
  • Understanding of ML ops and deployment practices
  • Experience with SQL and data manipulation
  • Education: Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
  • Languages: Fluency in English, and Dutch or French, with at least passive knowledge of the other

What NORRIQ Offers You

  • Be part of a fast-growing, international organization with a unique and people-centered culture
  • Enjoy a highly competitive compensation package, including a company car, iPhone, and additional allowances
  • Access extensive training programs in Belgium and Denmark, focusing on both technical expertise and soft skills
  • Work with a dynamic and diverse team of experienced professionals and young talent in a collaborative environment within the financial services sector

Join NORRIQ to elevate your career, contribute to transformative projects, and make a lasting impact in the financial services industry!

Title: Graduate Talent Scientist
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

Our Talent Science team has a mission to ensure that we follow objective, scientifically rigorous and efficient processes to select the very best new colleagues regardless of location, culture or background. We work closely with our key stakeholders to ensure that decisions are being made in the right way and that our hiring model supports the selection of world class talent. We lead an effective hiring ecosystem to deliver talent acquisition excellence. We leverage data to enable evidence-based decisions, weaving behavioural science through our selection process, working closely with our Hiring Leadership team who drive hiring at Canonical.

We are looking for exceptional people to join our team at the entry level. You will possess a psychology based degree with an exceptional academic track record from high school. You will also bring some relevant experience from the field of talent, from either university coursework relating to talent selection or from an internship or first job in a talent team. In this role you will learn how to implement hiring strategies that result in high performance outcomes of our people and contribute to leading our talent agenda.

The suitable candidate will bring an analytical mindset with a high level of curiosity to integrate data to draw insights and outcomes using SQL or Python. You will have the ability to prioritise and deliver work in a fast paced environment with a good level of self motivation and drive to operate in our remote based environment. With a keen interest in the assessment of talent you will demonstrate a passion for understanding human decisions and behaviours. Great communication skills are also key to this role as you will be working closely with senior stakeholders to ensure they stay on track with their hiring targets. Finally, we would like you to bring a passion and interest for technology platforms and automations to help us drive efficiencies in our processes.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

The role entails


Learning how to assess candidates using behavioural interview techniques.
Gaining a deep appreciation of the use of psychometrics in the workplace.
Working on process and documentation efficiencies that fuel our hiring practices.
Contributing to projects that drive successful hiring outcomes, many of which require advanced analytics skills to integrate data to draw insights.
Building excellent stakeholder relationships to help design and implement solutions to complex problems that ultimately ensure we hire exceptional talent.
Gaining a deep understanding of our systems and platforms to problem solve and support on hiring questions.
Being at the forefront of ticket support and company channel questions, helping to solve issues as you gain a deep understanding of our processes.


What we are looking for in you


Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university, with an undergraduate degree in a psychology or people based subject.
Advanced analytical ability to dissect and analyse data using SQL, with Python and/or advanced statistical analysis advantageous.
Exposure to the topic of talent through university degree coursework, a relevant internship or first job.
A passion for working in the technology space with evidence as to why.
Results driven with the ability to work at pace, with strong project management skills to roadmap, plan and deliver objectives working with the team.
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills.
Drive, ambitious and curiosity to own breakthroughs in the talent field.
Ability to travel internationally 2-4 times a year, for company events, occasionally for two weeks.


Nice-to-have skills


Advanced theory of psychometrics
A deep understanding of the topic of intrinsic motivation


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more
