Title: Principal Assistant
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

28-Sep-2025, 10:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

5,195.80

Grade

NATO Grade G12


SUMMARY



The NATO Office of Resources (NOR) provides independent and integrated expert advice to the Secretary General, NATO Resource Committees, Allies, and other stakeholders on the planning, allocation and utilisation of military common funding made available to achieve NATO‚Äôs goals and objectives.

The NOR advice is based on sound judgement underpinned by facts, figures expertise and knowledge. It follows NATO policies, procedures and standards, and is independent of external stakeholder‚Äôs viewpoints. It supports efficient and effective use of public funds by assessing the policy compliance, eligibility, affordability, technical viability, and lifecycle implications of military requirements and proposed solutions. Furthermore, the NOR facilitates resource-informed political decision-making.

The incumbent will carry out the duties of the Principal Assistant to the Director and also supports the Deputy Director as required. The Principal Assistantis accountable for efficiently handling a wide range of administrative and organizational support duties and should demonstrate strong ethics of integrity, confidentiality and diplomatic tact when dealing with sensitive issues.


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE



Essential

The incumbent must:


have a good general education at least to higher secondary level;
have at least 6 years previous experience in provision of office administrative support;
have experience managing the calendars, travel arrangements, hospitality events, and meeting preparation of senior managers;
have proficiency in Microsoft Office software (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and SharePoint);
have proficiency in document management (workflow, quality control, and distribution);
have strong written and oral communication skills; including the ability to edit documents;
possess the following minimum levels of NATO‚Äôs official languages (English/French): V (‚ÄòAdvanced‚Äô) in one; and III (‚ÄòIntermediate') in the other.



DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:


have experience as a principal assistant at senior executive level;
have experience working in a multinational environment;
have a good understanding of the NATO environment, structures, practices, and procedures;
be familiar with Information Knowledge Management, and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems and tools;
possess fluency in both official NATO languages.
MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES



Expertise Development

Proactively develop and apply expertise and skills related to administrative support and technology. Leverage knowledge with other colleagues and contribute to the development of others.

Financial Management

Ensure proper administration of financial resources allocated to DNOR, in particular as regards mission travel and hospitality, ensuring proper procedures are followed.

Information Management

Support the efficient flow of information within, into, and out of the NOR, in particular through prompt handling of incoming/outgoing correspondence. Prepare, edit, and format various documents for DNOR's signature using standard software packages.

Knowledge Management

Collect, categorise, input and track information in the NATO knowledge management system, ensuring data quality and relevance.

Organizational Efficiencies

Analyze, recommend and implement organizational efficiencies that improve procedures and processes related to office management.

Planning and Execution

Organise own work to ensure the accurate and timely execution of duties. Administer DNOR‚Äôs schedule as well as DDNOR‚Äôs as required: arrange meetings and handle related details, such as travel. Administer DNOR's representational activities. Provide administrative support to DNOR and DDNOR as required. Review and quality control documents submitted for DNOR‚Äôs signature.

Project Management

Contribute to or conduct small projects, as tasked by DNOR.

Stakeholder Management

Liaise and coordinate across the NOR to ensure efficiency in daily management of the work. Clarify and contribute to stakeholders' expectations by liaising and coordinating with a network of contacts across NATO. Maintain regular contacts with senior members of Delegations, Divisions and Directorates, the IMS, Strategic Commands, and other callers or visitors to the NOR Front Office.

Perform any other related duties as assigned.


INTERRELATIONSHIPS



The incumbent reports to the Director, NOR. The Principal Assistantworks closely with senior leadership of the NOR and under the general oversight and coordination with the Executive Officer to include their tasking authority, as required. The incumbent maintains a working relationship with other Assistants throughout the NOR and in other IS Divisions and Independent Offices.

Direct reports: N/A

Indirect reports: N/A


COMPETENCIES



The incumbent must demonstrate:


Clarity and Accuracy: Monitors others' work for clarity
Customer Service Orientation: Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems
Empathy: Reads non-verbal cues and understands meanings
Flexibility: Acts with flexibility
Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation
Organisational Awareness: Understands organisational climate and culture
Teamwork: Solicits inputs and encourages others
CONTRACT



Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years‚Äô duration; possibility of an indefinite duration contract thereafter.

Contract clause applicable:

In accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Regulations, the successful candidate will receive a definite duration contract of three years, which may be followed by an indefinite duration contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO‚Äôs member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.

Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Regulations.


USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS



Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:


For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link );
For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment



Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.

Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.

More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate‚Äôs medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO‚Äôs sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION



NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply.

NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process.

Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation.

Building Integrity is a key element of NATO‚Äôs core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work.

Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with.

Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements.

The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours.

The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements.

Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment.

For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab.

NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with.

Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements.

The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours.

The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements.

Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment.

For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab.

NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

Title: Junior Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst
Description:
About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels‚Äô WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices ‚Äì our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Nestl√©, EU and Belgian institutions, fuelling their success internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a "lab‚Äù mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

ROLE

As a Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst, you‚Äôll help uncover meaningful insights from social, digital, and search data to support strategic thinking and creative development. You‚Äôll explore what people are saying, sharing, and searching online to better understand audience behaviours, identify cultural trends, and help shape recommendations for leading international brands.

This role is perfect for someone who‚Äôs naturally curious about people and culture, excited by the ever-changing digital world, and eager to grow in a collaborative, social-first agency environment.

Responsibilities


Support the analysis of social and digital data using tools like Talkwalker, Tubular, RivalIQ, Semrush, GlobalWebIndex, and proprietary OSL dashboards.
Help build clear, insightful reports that highlight audience behaviors, cultural trends, and campaign opportunities.
Work closely with strategists and planners to contribute data that informs content and communication strategies.
Assist in developing regular social listening and trend-monitoring reports.
Participate in client presentations and internal meetings to share insights in a clear and engaging way.
Collaborate with data teams across Ogilvy and WPP, as well as third-party providers.
Stay curious about the digital world; new platforms, tools, formats, and audience behaviours.


PROFILE


1‚Äì3 years of experience in digital, social, or search data analytics, insights, or related roles.
Strong interest in digital culture, social media trends, and emerging technologies.
Familiar with tools such as Talkwalker, Tubular, RivalIQ, GlobalWebIndex, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, or similar (training can be provided).
Comfortable working with both quantitative and qualitative data and turning findings into simple, useful insights.
A basic understanding of digital performance metrics (organic and paid) across key platforms.
Proficient in English. French or Dutch is a plus.
Curious, detail-oriented, and motivated to learn from more senior analysts and strategists.
Good communicator with strong reporting and visualization skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Google Slides, or data viz tools).
A team player who thrives in a collaborative, fast-moving environment.


OFFER


Full-time opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels - the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional, and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency - Our words and promises produce actions.
Attractive package and benefits
Strong flexibility plan
Continuous training opportunities
As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.
Show more

Title: Junior / Medior AI Engineer
Description:
About the Role

Securex is expanding its data and AI capabilities, leveraging Microsoft Fabric and the Microsoft AI ecosystem to deliver impactful business use cases. We are looking for a proactive and self-driven AI Engineer with a solid foundation in AI development using Microsoft technologies, ready to take ownership of exploring and implementing solutions in a fast-evolving environment.

This is not a typical role where you will be trained by senior AI engineers ‚Äî instead, you will be the one exploring possibilities, building solutions, and guiding us in applying AI best practices. You will work closely with our data engineering and business teams to design, develop, and deploy AI-driven solutions, while continuously expanding your own expertise.




Key Responsibilities

Independently research, design, and implement AI solutions using Microsoft AI services (Azure AI, Azure Machine Learning, Cognitive Services, etc.).
Integrate AI models into the Microsoft Fabric ecosystem and data pipelines.
Develop proof-of-concepts and translate them into scalable, production-ready solutions.
Proactively identify opportunities where AI can add value to the business.
Stay ahead of emerging Microsoft AI capabilities and share insights with the team.
Document your work and create reusable frameworks or components for future use cases.




What are we looking for?




About You

You have hands-on experience in AI development, ideally using Microsoft AI services.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable working with modern data engineering workflows.
You bring experience (or strong interest) in Microsoft Fabric.
You are highly self-motivated, curious, and able to work independently.
You thrive on solving complex problems and can turn abstract ideas into practical solutions.
You are a confident communicator, able to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Skills & Expertise

Artificial Intelligence (AI): Advanced (recent, hands-on)
Python: Advanced
Azure Data Factory: Intermediate
Azure DevOps: Intermediate




Languages

Dutch or French ‚Äî Native or bilingual proficiency
English ‚Äî Full professional proficiency
Show more

Title: Generative AI Engineer
Description:
CBSButler are partnered with a leading international technology consulting firm who are seeking an experienced freelance Generative AI Engineer to join their AI & Data Solutions practice. This team is at the forefront of delivering custom Large Language Model (LLM) solutions for highly regulated markets, including investment banking, insurance, and hedge funds.




This will be a 12 month contract, and we can pay up to ‚Ç¨950 per day for senior experienced engineers, and this will be hybrid working, requiring one or two days a week on site in Brussels.




This is a rare opportunity to work on cutting edge AI projects where compliance and security expertise are paramount. You‚Äôll be designing and building bespoke generative AI systems that are fully aligned with financial regulations, data privacy laws, and enterprise security standards.




Please see below for what you'll be doing:




Working on custom LLM Development: Fine tuning and optimising LLMs for financial and insurance specific use cases.
Enterprise Integration: Implement retrieval augmented generation (RAG) pipelines and integrate models with proprietary datasets.
Regulatory Compliance: Ensure models adhere to relevant regulations (GDPR, MiFID II, Basel III, Solvency II) and internal governance frameworks.
Collaboration: Partner with financial consultants, data engineers, and compliance teams to align solutions with business and regulatory needs.




Required Skills & Experience




Proven track record working with LLM frameworks for example: Hugging Face, LangChain, LlamaIndex, OpenAI API
Strong experience with Python, PyTorch or TensorFlow, and modern NLP pipelines.
Hands on experience with RAG architectures, embeddings, and vector databases e.g. Pinecone, Weaviate, Milvus etc.
Understanding of model governance, bias mitigation, explainable AI, and secure AI deployment.




Nice to Have




Experience with synthetic data generation for safe model training
Familiarity with RLHF Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback
Knowledge of financial data modelling or risk management analytics
Advanced quant degree MSc/PhD in AI, ML, Computer Science, or related field
Familiarity with cloud AI services and MLOps tools




If you're suitable and interested please send through an updated CV and I will call ASAP.

Title: Innovation Engineer
Description:
Who are we?




The innovation mission of NVISO is to leverage technology as a pivotal enabler for pioneering cyber security services that have a positive impact on our customers, brand exposure and bottom-line. The Labs team collaborates with all business units by offering an innovation framework, ambassadorship and in-house expertise to transform the best ideas into impactful outcomes. Building a well-oiled machine where people like to work & inspire all birds to become internal innovators are at the heart of our mission.


Tasks


As an Innovation Engineer in the NVISO Labs team your responsibilities will include:





Perform technical exploratory innovation activities (develop a technology prototype with the team, running a Proof-of-Concept in collaboration with our (internal) customers, etc.).


Design, write, test and document software for use in cutting-edge security products & tools developed in NVISO Labs


Collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate new technologies and methodologies into existing systems.


Engaging in continuous learning and development to stay updated with the latest industry trends and advancements.


Providing technical mentorship and guidance to junior team members to foster a culture of innovation and technical excellence.


Participating in brainstorming sessions and innovation workshops to contribute new ideas and solutions that address current and future cybersecurity challenges.



Requirements



You are eligible for NATO Clearance.


At least 3 years of relevant work experience in software or innovation engineering.


A master's degree in computer science or a related technical field.


Experience with Python and knowledge of additional programming languages.


Understanding of fundamental software & infrastructure design principles.


Experience with integrating new technologies and methodologies into existing systems.


Strong testing, troubleshooting and debugging skills.


Basic knowledge of secure software design and security best practices.


Excellent English communications skills, both verbal and written.


Strong interpersonal communication skills (oral & written) that enable effective work in a collaborative team environment (across the entire company).



Benefits


At NVISO, we care. We are committed to offering you a highly competitive remuneration package including financial and non-financial components:





A training budget of 10.000‚Ç¨ and 10 days every 2 years;


Company car and Belgian fuel card;


Working and learning from the best people in the European cyber security industry. We have multiple SANS Instructors working at NVISO, our staff has presented at popular hacking conferences (BlackHat, BruCON, OWASP, etc.) and all of our technical staff can acquire deep technical security certifications (GSE, GXPN, GREM, GCFA, OSCP, etc.);


An entrepreneurial and agile company, where you will be stimulated and supported in driving new initiatives (either through internal innovation or by improving our service offering), without losing sight of having fun!;


Regular team-building and fun events with legendary off-site events once a year. The location of the next team building is one of the most closely guarded secrets at NVISO‚Ä¶ We can however disclose that we‚Äôve visited Lisbon, Dubai and Malta over the past few years;


Our commitment to coach, counsel, and help you grow; each employee receives a personal coach within the team, whose role is to ensure your well-being and helps you grow in your career!;


Flexible working hours, homeworking and the possibility to work from abroad;


Flexible Income Plan;


32 Paid leaves.





IF YOU‚ÄôRE INTERESTED, PLEASE SEND US YOUR APPLICATION!




WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

Show more

  • Regular team-building and fun events with legendary off-site events once a year. The location of the next team building is one of the most closely guarded secrets at NVISO‚Ä¶ We can however disclose that we‚Äôve visited Lisbon, Dubai and Malta over the past few years;

  • Our commitment to coach, counsel, and help you grow; each employee receives a personal coach within the team, whose role is to ensure your well-being and helps you grow in your career!;

  • Flexible working hours, homeworking and the possibility to work from abroad;

  • Flexible Income Plan;

  • 32 Paid leaves.


IF YOU‚ÄôRE INTERESTED, PLEASE SEND US YOUR APPLICATION!


WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

Title: Management Traineeship
Description:
Job Description

Location: Brussels/Antwerp region | Start: August/September | Contract: Permanent

At JDE Peet‚Äôs, we believe great things happen over a cup of coffee or tea. With iconic brands like Douwe Egberts, L‚ÄôOR, Senseo, Jacqmotte and Pickwick, we bring coffee moments to life in over 100 countries around the world.

Kickstart your career with a tailor-made 2‚Äì3-year Management Traineeship with a commercial focus ‚Äî designed around your potential, your ambitions and your growth. You'll build a solid foundation for a successful career at JDE Peet's, with real responsibility, continuous learning, and support every step of the way. When you grow, we grow -and so does the world of coffee and tea.

What To Expect


Two rotations of each 12‚Äì18 months in areas like Inside Sales, Field Sales, Supply Chain,‚Ä¶
A first assignment as a Logistics Specialist. You‚Äôll invest in yourself by learning how to ensure the most efficient execution of the local Warehouse and distribution activities
Give support to the Supply Chain Team for all logistics related activities (cost control, PO-, invoice-, delivery-, KPI-, transport-, inventory-, pallet-management ‚Ä¶) within the country Supply Chain organization
Strive for a high-as-possible service level towards internal and external customers
Focusing on continuous improvement of logistics operations (using root-cause-analysis, initiatives, projects ‚Ä¶) to increase performance, customer service level and reduce operational costs.
Learn through hands-on experience, mentoring and targeted training
Please note: this is not an internship, but a full-time position with real responsibilities from day one.


What‚Äôs in it for you?


A permanent contract from the start
Competitive salary and a full benefits package, including an Electric company car + charging card, smartphone with plan & data, internet allowance, meal & ecovouchers, group & hospitalization insurance, a bonus opportunity
Flexibility: We value meeting colleagues in the office (Esplanade 1, 1020 Brussels: only 10 minutes‚Äô walk from Metro Heysel) and we enjoy our focus time when working from home: we support you in getting the right ergonomic material to work from home efficiently and even offer the option to take a ‚Äòworkation‚Äô! Next to that you can customize your benefits package through our flex income plan.
A dynamic and supportive environment where you can truly make an impact and learn through experience


Qualifications

Who are we looking for?


You‚Äôre a graduate (Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs) or have up to 2 years of work experience ‚Äî and you‚Äôre available to start in August or September.
Fluency in Dutch and English, with a good knowledge of French
Based near Antwerp/Brussels or willing to relocate
Curious, ambitious and ready to take ownership
A true coffee or tea lover who wants to kickstart a meaningful career


Additional Information

What‚Äôs it like to work at JDE Peet‚Äôs?

We are people united by the power and possibility of tea and coffee. At JDE Peet‚Äôs, we thrive on the freedom to pursue opportunities, provoking new ideas to make an impact at scale. Our ambition is simple ‚Äì JDE Peet's: unleashing the possibilities of coffee and tea.

Our DE&I Statement

At JDE Peet‚Äôs we aim to create a better future where we authentically serve, reflect and embrace everyone. We believe in fostering a more diverse, equitable and inclusive organisation where everyone feels comfortable to truly be who they are and unleash their full potential. This means we do not tolerate discrimination on the basis of our race, ethnicity, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, age, disability, or any other trait protected by law. Do not hesitate to reach out if you require any reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process.

What‚Äôs next?

Interested? We‚Äôd love to hear from you! After we received your application we will do our utmost to give you quick feedback. Part of the recruitment procedure will be an online assessment, followed by interviews and a business case.

Learn more: https://careers.jacobsdouweegberts.com

#unleashyourpossibility #acupofamazing

Title: Lead AI Application Engineer
Description:
About Us

BOI is pioneering the field of AI strategy and applied AI, partnering with large-scale, ambitious businesses around the world to ideate, design, and build AI products that transform the way they work. We don't just help organizations imagine what's possible - we build the software that turns that vision into reality.

We work across different sectors and functions and have built a world-class team that unites commercial expertise, smart strategy, and technology. If you're passionate about building enterprise AI products from 0->1 and leading projects at the forefront of AI innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About The Role

We are looking for a Lead AI Application Engineer to integrate foundational models into innovative tools and workflows for our clients, with a strong focus on building agentic tools that adapt and respond to complex user needs. You will be at the forefront of AI-powered product development, focusing on embedding foundational models into applications, building workflows, and ensuring seamless performance. The ideal candidate has experience working in a consulting or agency environment and thrives in dynamic, project-based work.

This is a hands-on role where you will be responsible for building and implementing systems from the ground up. You would write production-level code while defining processes and best practices for future team growth.

Responsibilities


Integrate APIs for foundational models (e.g. OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face) into scalable applications
Develop and optimize workflows for foundational model use cases, including prompt engineering, embedding generation, and real-time decision-making for agentic tools
Implement and manage vector-based search systems and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) setups
Monitor the performance of AI systems, troubleshoot issues, and improve outputs to align with client needs
Collaborate with data engineers to integrate harmonized data into AI workflows
Work with full-stack engineers to embed AI functionalities into user-facing applications
Stay updated on the latest advancements in AI APIs, tools, and techniques to deliver innovative solutions.



Requirements


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field
A minimum of 6 years of professional experience in software engineering, with at least 1 year of experience working on AI applications
Proven experience working in a consulting or agency environment on project-based work
Strong knowledge of foundational model APIs and experience AI application builds
Ability to translate complex client needs into technical solutions using foundational models
Experience building tools with agentic capabilities to adapt and automate workflows
Advanced English skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate effectively in an international team



We Offer The Following Benefits


25 days of annual holiday allowance
Company car or mobility budget
WFH allowance
Company laptop & phone
Meal Vouchers
Social allowance
Ecocheques
Sports and Culture cheques
Annual bonus
Show more

Title: Python Fullstack Developer
Description:
Location: Brussels, with the option to work from home up to three days a week. In case of travels to Germany, Client willcover all costs.

Languages: English and French / Dutch

Employment Type: Freelancer

Start Date: ASAP

Context of the mission/objective(s) of the job

Our client is looking for one new Senior Python Fullstack developer with strong experience in React to work within our Innovation team. The goal is to support the migration and maintenance of a platform that was developed in-house, where our client group employees can get an overview, of innovation focussed projects.

Requirements


Experience working with Python 3.11+ and FastAPI
Experience working with React and TypeScript
Experience working with PostgreSQL
Experience configuring CI/CD pipelines (preferable Azure DevOps)
Experience with testing (Python as well as React)
Experience working with Docker


Soft Skills: The candidate should possess good communication skills, take accountability for the tasks and likes to challenge the status quo.

Languages


You are able to speak, read and write fluently English and French or Dutch
French, with a passive understanding of Flemish
Flemish, with a passive understanding of French
English

Title: Marktonderzoeker, Data science
Company: CUBE - Consumer and Customer Understanding Belgium
Description:
Voor wie en waarom zoeken we?

Voor een vooraanstaand Belgisch marktonderzoeksbureau, gevestigd in Mechelen, zoeken wij een Marktonderzoeker die een eerste ervaring heeft gehad in onderzoek. We zoeken iemand die in staat is om complexe marketing-vraagstukken op te lossen door het initi√´ren en begeleiden van gerichte kwantitatieve onderzoekstrajecten. Dit bedrijf hecht waarde aan een warme en familiaire sfeer, waar collega‚Äôs dicht bij elkaar staan en waar het cre√´ren van een omgeving waarin iedereen zich betrokken voelt belangrijk is. De missie is gericht op het laten groeien van zowel medewerkers als klanten.

Hoe maak jij het verschil?


Als Research Executive met focus op data-analyse heb je een passie om in data te duiken en ga je ook verder dan de cijfers alleen. Het uitvoeren van analyses is de belangrijkste focus van deze functie. Complexe onderzoeksdesigns en geavanceerde analyses schrikken je niet af.
Je werkt voornamelijk in SPSS maar er is een sterke interesse in andere programmeertalen zoals Visual Basic, R, Python,‚Ä¶ Je vindt het leuk om te zoeken naar de meest optimale (geautomatiseerde) manier om aan data-analyse te doen.
Je bent iemand die zich graag in een probleem vastbijt en je houdt ervan om antwoorden te vinden op onderzoeks- of bedrijfsvragen.
Je bent praktisch en georganiseerd, je kan zelfstandig werken op een nauwkeurige, consistente en proactieve manier
Je bent nauwkeurig en precies in je werk
Je bent zelfstandig, gemotiveerd om continu bij te leren en nieuwe analysetechnieken eigen te maken
Je hebt interesse in de menselijke psyche en je denkt graag na over marketingvraagstukken, je legt graag verbanden en houdt van puzzelen tot aan de oplossing


Je taken


De focus voor deze functie ligt op het uitvoeren van analyses op data afkomstig uit kwantitatief onderzoek:
Programmeren en testen van vragenlijsten
Opmaken van onderzoekstabellen
Basisanalyse van data in SPSS (datacleaning, datamanipulaties)
Data-herstructuren als voorbereiding voor complexe analyses (SPSS icm Python, R)
Geavanceerde analyses uitvoeren in SPSS (regressie, correspondentie, clustering, ‚Ä¶)
De onderzoeksonderwerpen kunnen sterk vari√´ren, zowel qua marketingonderwerp (innovatie-onderzoek, klantentevredenheid, communicatie,‚Ä¶) als qua sector (energie, overheid, telecom, FMCG, media‚Ä¶). Na een inwerkperiode kan je doorgroeien naar een Senior functie waar je volledig de projecten zelfstandig zal opvolgen (in samenwerking met de manager voor begeleiding & coaching).

Wie zoeken we?


Je bent gepassioneerd door data en analyses
Je bent nauwkeurig en hebt oog voor detail
Je bent iemand die graag op zoek gaat naar hoe een data-analyse beter en sneller kan
Je beschikt over een Masterdiploma (Psychologie, Sociologie, Toegepaste Economische Wetenschappen, Marketing, Handelswetenschappen‚Ä¶) of vergelijkbaar Bachelor-diploma
Je houdt van technologie en digitale transformatie. Alle tools, sociale media, apps en software die kunnen helpen om ons vak naar een hoger niveau te tillen.
Ervaring is een pluspunt maar niet noodzakelijk: wij investeren in jouw persoonlijk groeipad, zowel als marktonderzoeker als je analyse- en communicatievaardigheden in het algemeen
Je bent een echte teamplayer. Onze waarden zijn nieuwsgierigheid, respect en vertrouwen.


Wat hebben we in de aanbieding?


Een sterk groeiend bedrijf met ondertussen 10 werknemers, waar je volop kansen krijgt om mee te groeien en waar je direct een grote impact kan hebben op de resultaten.
Je komt terecht in een hecht team van collega‚Äôs met veel expertise en passie voor hun job, die opleidingen en mogelijkheden tot bijleren stimuleren.
Teamspirit wordt hoog in het vaandel gedragen, waarbij er ook regelmatig afterworks, teametentjes, een kerstfeest, ‚Ä¶ georganiseerd worden.
Het bedrijf is gelegen op een goed bereikbare locatie (Mechelen Zuid), en ze bieden een hybride werkomgeving waar je kantoor- en telewerk kan combineren.
Last but not least bieden ze je uiteraard een mooi & competitief maandsalaris aan.


Cultuur en missie

De bedrijfscultuur is warm en familiaal, waarbij iedereen dicht bij elkaar staat en er rekening gehouden wordt met de menselijke aspecten. De missie is gericht op het laten groeien van zowel onze medewerkers als klanten. Ze benaderen ontwikkeling op een persoonlijke manier, waarbij ze individuele groei centraal stellen. Ze streven ernaar mensgerichte personen aan te trekken, waarbij er geen ruimte is voor competitie of ego‚Äôs. Het team staat boven het individu, en er is een fel geloof dat dit de sleutel is tot gezamenlijk succes.

Interesse om te solliciteren? Neem contact op met Milan Pelgrims.
Show more

Title: Junior consultant ‚Äì Strategie & Organisatie
Description:
De opportuniteit




Heb jij zin om een maatschappelijke stempel te drukken? Ben je vertrouwd met de werking van overheden of heb je interesse om deze te leren kennen? Bezit je een goede dosis people skills en ben je enthousiast om uitdagende projecten aan te gaan?




Dan ben jij misschien de persoon die we zoeken. Bij IMPACT public sector advisors zijn we op zoek naar een junior consultant die wil bijdragen aan een performante overheid en non-profitsector.




Functie




Je leidt eigen projecten binnen jouw expertisegebied en stuurt op termijn een beperkt projectteam aan¬†
Je overlegt met de klant om de meest gepaste oplossing en strategie te vinden¬†¬†
Je leidt workshops met klanten en stakeholders
Je wordt ingeschakeld om nieuwe opportuniteiten te detecteren en binnen te halen¬†




Profielvereisten




Je hebt een masterdiploma
Je hebt tussen 2 en 4 jaar relevante ervaring binnen consulting of projectmanagement in (√©√©n of verschillende van) volgende domeinen: organisatiestrategie (bepalen van missie, visie, strategische en operationele objectieven, ‚Ä¶), organisatieontwikkeling (personeelsplanning, organisatiedesign, ‚Ä¶), procesmanagement (optimalisatie, interne audit, interne controle,..), veranderingsmanagement, programma- en projectmanagementnt
Je hebt affiniteit met de publieke sector (ervaring is een pluspunt)
Je communiceert helder en hebt een goede schrijfstijl
Je bent vloeiend in het Nederlands en je hebt kennis van het Frans
Je bent in staat om snel persoonlijk vertrouwen op te bouwen door je expertise aan te tonen
Je hebt een sterk analytisch vermogen om complexe problemen aan te kaarten met inzichtvolle, praktische en gestructureerde oplossingen.
Je bent een teamspeler
Je hebt een positieve houding en gevoel voor humor




IMPACT ‚Äì Wie zijn we en waar staan we voor?




Het DNA van IMPACT wordt gekenmerkt door de wens om echte meerwaarde te cre√´ren voor de maatschappij. We maakten de keuze om ons te richten op overheden (zowel lokaal, gewestelijk, federaal als Europees) en de non-profitsector die dit expliciet als doelstelling hebben. Wij willen hen ondersteunen in hun missies door onze expertise aan te wenden voor de grote vraagstukken waar zij voor staan. Zo hopen we bij te dragen aan positieve verandering.




We hebben een bewezen trackrecord voor diverse klanten in uitdagende projecten rond strategie en verandering, operationalisering en evaluatie.¬†




Wat we bieden




Een klein, maar hecht team van 10 personen, met veel aanwezige expertise

Een omgeving waarin je wordt uitgedaagd om het beste uit jezelf te halen met veel boeiende, maatschappelijk relevante projecten¬†

De vrijheid om je werk zelf te organiseren, te ondernemen en zelf initiatief te nemen.¬†¬†

De mogelijkheid om te blijven leren en jezelf te ontwikkelen.¬†¬†

Een aantrekkelijk loon met extralegale voordelen (gsm, laptop, bedrijfswagen, hospitalisatieverzekering,‚Ä¶)¬†




Wij zijn voor deze vacature op zoek naar een vaste medewerker. Freelanceconsultants zullen niet weerhouden worden.¬†




Solliciteren voor dez functie kan enkel door CV en motivatiebrief te bezorgen via elisabet.okmen@impactconsulting.be

HTML:
De opportuniteit


Heb jij zin om een maatschappelijke stempel te drukken? Ben je vertrouwd met de werking van overheden of heb je interesse om deze te leren kennen? Bezit je een goede dosis people skills en ben je enthousiast om uitdagende projecten aan te gaan?


Dan ben jij misschien de persoon die we zoeken. Bij IMPACT public sector advisors zijn we op zoek naar een junior consultant die wil bijdragen aan een performante overheid en non-profitsector.


Functie


  • Je leidt eigen projecten binnen jouw expertisegebied en stuurt op termijn een beperkt projectteam aan 
  • Je overlegt met de klant om de meest gepaste oplossing en strategie te vinden  
  • Je leidt workshops met klanten en stakeholders
  • Je wordt ingeschakeld om nieuwe opportuniteiten te detecteren en binnen te halen 


Profielvereisten


  • Je hebt een masterdiploma
  • Je hebt tussen 2 en 4 jaar relevante ervaring binnen consulting of projectmanagement in (√©√©n of verschillende van) volgende domeinen: organisatiestrategie (bepalen van missie, visie, strategische en operationele objectieven, ‚Ä¶), organisatieontwikkeling (personeelsplanning, organisatiedesign, ‚Ä¶), procesmanagement (optimalisatie, interne audit, interne controle,..), veranderingsmanagement, programma- en projectmanagementnt
  • Je hebt affiniteit met de publieke sector (ervaring is een pluspunt)
  • Je communiceert helder en hebt een goede schrijfstijl
  • Je bent vloeiend in het Nederlands en je hebt kennis van het Frans
  • Je bent in staat om snel persoonlijk vertrouwen op te bouwen door je expertise aan te tonen
  • Je hebt een sterk analytisch vermogen om complexe problemen aan te kaarten met inzichtvolle, praktische en gestructureerde oplossingen.
  • Je bent een teamspeler
  • Je hebt een positieve houding en gevoel voor humor


IMPACT ‚Äì Wie zijn we en waar staan we voor?


Het DNA van IMPACT wordt gekenmerkt door de wens om echte meerwaarde te cre√´ren voor de maatschappij. We maakten de keuze om ons te richten op overheden (zowel lokaal, gewestelijk, federaal als Europees) en de non-profitsector die dit expliciet als doelstelling hebben. Wij willen hen ondersteunen in hun missies door onze expertise aan te wenden voor de grote vraagstukken waar zij voor staan. Zo hopen we bij te dragen aan positieve verandering.


We hebben een bewezen trackrecord voor diverse klanten in uitdagende projecten rond strategie en verandering, operationalisering en evaluatie. 


Wat we bieden


Een klein, maar hecht team van 10 personen, met veel aanwezige expertise

Een omgeving waarin je wordt uitgedaagd om het beste uit jezelf te halen met veel boeiende, maatschappelijk relevante projecten 

De vrijheid om je werk zelf te organiseren, te ondernemen en zelf initiatief te nemen.  

De mogelijkheid om te blijven leren en jezelf te ontwikkelen.  

Een aantrekkelijk loon met extralegale voordelen (gsm, laptop, bedrijfswagen, hospitalisatieverzekering,‚Ä¶)

Title: Technoloog Biomedisch laboratorium Hematologie-Chemie
Description:
Onderneming

De dynamische equipe van het Biologische Klinische labo ‚Äì departement Hematologie ‚Äì (ISO-geaccrediteerd 15189) zoekt een gemotiveerde collega om kwalitatieve medische analyses te garanderen.

De Europa Ziekenhuizen, geaccrediteerd door JCI, zijn een referentieziekenhuis voor Brussel en omgeving. Als meertalig algemeen ziekenhuis bieden wij een volledig zorgaanbod aan op onze beide sites (St-Elisabeth in Ukkel en St-Michiel in Etterbeek/Europese Wijk) en onze twee poliklinieken (Bella Vita Medisch Centrum in Waterloo en Inkendaal).

In onze instelling worden dagelijks 2500 pati√´nten verzorgd. Onze 300 specialisten en 1800 personeelsleden zetten dag na dag hun competenties voor hen in om, met respect voor eenieder, een doeltreffende en correcte diagnose te stellen, een aangepaste behandeling voor te stellen en een gepersonaliseerde benadering te waarborgen. Wij kunnen hiervoor een beroep doen op geavanceerde medische technologie in een moderne infrastructuur zodat we aan elke pati√´nt de beste zorgkwaliteit kunnen bieden, in alle veiligheid en met maximaal comfort.

Functie

In Samenwerking Met De Directie Van Het Labo, Het Administratieve Personeel En De Andere Technologen, Neem Je De Volgende Verantwoordelijkheden Op Binnen De Dienst


Hematologie met een polyvalentie in chemie en de bloedbank
Verfijnen van nieuwe technieken
Betrokkenheid bij het accreditatieproces voor ISO 15189


Na een periode van begeleiding en vorming, ontwikkel je je tot een professionele technoloog in een modern labo, gebruik makend van vooruitstrevende technologie.

Profiel


Je hebt een bachelor biomedische laboratorium-technologie met een WIV erkenning (of in procedure)
Een eerste ervaring in de sector is een meerwaarde
Tweetaligheid Frans-Nederlands is een pluspunt
Je bent dynamisch, georganiseerd, betrouwbaar, zelfstandig en stressbestendig
Je hebt een scherp onderscheindingsvermogen bij medische noodgevallen
Je getuigt van echte teamspirit
Je hebt een sterke focus op het behalen van kwaliteitsnormen
Je hebt een goede beheersing van basis IT tools
Je werkt op afwisselende uren (van 7u tot 15u, van 8u tot 16u, van 12u tot 20u, in het weekend en op feestdagen)
Voldoen aan de wettelijke vereisten voor tweetaligheid (FR/NL) of bereid zijn om deze te ontwikkelen (gratis taalcursussen)


Aanbod

Wij Bieden u Een Voltijds Of Deeltijds Vast Contract In Een Modern, Kwaliteitsvol Ziekenhuis. Naast Een Baremieke Verloning Die Een Jaarlijkse Salarisverhoging Garandeert, Een Eindejaarspremie, Alsook Werkzekerheid Binnen Een Ziekenhuis Dat De Pati√´nt En Zijn Personeel Centraal Stelt, Bieden Wij u


Werken in een ziekenhuis met JCI- accreditatie, de garantie voor een toewijding aan kwaliteitsvolle zorg, pati√´ntveiligheid en professionele teams
Een DKV hospitalisatieverzekering in Belgi√´ en in het buitenland
Voorkeurtarieven voor medische zorg in onze ziekenhuizen voor u en de mensen van hetzelfde huishouden
Interne en externe opleidingen
Gratis taalopleiding in groep of immersie
Telefoonabonnement betaald door de werkgever na het slagen voor een tweetaligheidstest
Een deel van de kosten van de aangeboden maaltijden wordt betaald door het ziekenhuis
1 extra dag anci√´nniteitsverlof per 5 jaar, zonder maximumlimiet
Terugbetaling vervoerskosten (openbaar vervoer, fiets, auto)
Exclusieve voordelen dankzij Benefits@Work op aantrekkelijke merken, waarmee u het hele jaar door bespaart
Welzijnsprogramma en organisatie van sportieve uitdagingen en gratis groepslessen (Crossfit, SquadEasy, Run@Work)


Sollicitaties (motivatiebrief en curriculum vitae) moeten worden verzonden via onze website!

Diversiteit in al haar dimensies is een essenti√´le waarde bij Cliniques de l'Europe. Wij zijn ervan overtuigd dat geslacht, afkomst, leeftijd, seksuele geaardheid, levensovertuiging of handicap allemaal elementen zijn die onze individualiteit en de kracht van onze teams vormen.

Title: Full-stack Developer (EU only)
Description:
Job Description

Important:

Nationality: EU only

Contract: Freelancer

Type: Long-term, Full-time, On-site/Hybrid (living/relocation in Brussels is a must)

Daily Tasks/Responsibilities:


Migrating many applications to a container based model, using jdk 21 spring 6, and docker compose, cleaning up code smells, refactoring complex logics, covering with unit tests basically using mockito and sonarqube, implement a new security layer using spring security + oidc.
Responsible for designing and implementing new features and bug fix following the best market practices.
Monitor and troubleshoot applications using Dynatrace.


Mandatory Experience (perfect fit):


Minimum 11 years of IT-related experience.
Java, WebSphere server, Spring boot, Azure infrastructure (Pipelines, KeyVault), GitHub Devops, RedHat OpenShift, Docker, REST API‚Äôs, Swagger, Maven, Junit, Mockito, Checkmarx platform, Cassandra, Oracle/MySQL database, Git, Grafana/ELK stack, Centreon, Prometheus, Service Now, Dynatrace, Sonaqube, Prisma Cloud


Qualifications

Bachelor degree in IT or similar field

Title: Data Scientist 80‚Äì100%
Description:
At Sunrise, we think bigger, go further and create new ideas. For us working culture means achieving great things together. It‚Äôs where respect and innovative ideas combine with real teamwork ‚Äì every voice counts, every perspective makes us stronger. Our passion spurs us on to try new things and grow continuously. Sound like you? Then join our success story.

As an exceptional analyst and advisor, your audience will include Sunrise‚Äôs senior leaders and decision-makers. You will be able to use your creativity, technical prowess, business acumen and communication skills to solve some of the toughest challenges the company faces. We are looking for someone who thrives on digging into a business domain to find new opportunities, understands the value of rigorous statistical analysis, and turns data into clear, confident decisions. If you like the sound of tackling everything from causal inference problems to simulations that help shape strategy - and if you enjoy teaming up with smart folks across the business to offer advice, challenge ideas, and guide decisions - this role will be a great fit for you.

YOUR CHALLENGE:

Our initiatives are always changing, so here is just a taste of the kind of topics you could be starting with:


Design and run nimble experiments - from study design to actionable insights, for example, we‚Äôre exploring new ways to measure how specific products affect customer churn
Simulate market and customer behavior - to advise decision-makers and help shape long-term company strategy
Derive recommendations from data - using a large number of free-text survey responses, identify topic clusters and ideate appropriate actions
Detect outliers in a large number of time series - support the data organization with an early detection tool for master data and data quality issues
Promote and help data-driven decision-making - through upskilling, coaching, and sharing success stories


YOUR SKILLS:


A University degree in a quantitative field (PhD preferred)
2‚Äì5 years in a similar role in industry or consulting; project lead experience required for Senior
Deep knowledge of statistics, machine learning and other analytical methods
Proficient in at least one statistical programming language and in SQL
A pragmatic approach when putting together a POC, but a keen eye for detail and a stickler for accuracy when it comes to taking a concept to production
Skilled at communicating and working effectively with non-technical stakeholders across the organization; self-motivated, dependable, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Fluent in English


At Sunrise, you‚Äôll be working in a dynamic and multinational environment where every voice is heard, perspectives are shared and values are lived. Diversity isn‚Äôt just a program for us, it‚Äôs part of our DNA. By celebrating our differences, we achieve great things together.

Sunrise has partnered with ¬´Advance ‚Äì Gender Equality in Business¬ª. We‚Äôve also been awarded the Swiss LGBTI label and ¬´Fair-ON-Pay Advanced¬ª certification as recognition for offering all our employees equal pay for work of equal value.

Ready to rise to the challenge? Then join the team and actively shape our future!

#ChallengersWanted

Information for agencies: Application dossiers sent or uploaded by placement agencies or similar are not desired, will therefore not be considered and will be deleted.

Title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
üöÄ We're hiring: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

üóì Start: ASAP

üìç Location: Geneva (4 days on-site, 1 day remote)

üìÖ Duration: Asap - Until end of March 2026




We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on and business-minded Data Scientist / ML Engineer to join a dynamic and high-impact team working on real-world machine learning solutions from recommender systems to Generative AI with measurable business ROI.




üéØ Your Mission

As part of a team of engineers, you will be in charge of designing, developing and deploying machine learning algorithms into production, while measuring their value and presenting results to key stakeholders.

Your responsibilities include:

Designing and deploying ML models (recommender systems, classifiers, Generative AI)
Measuring the ROI of models in production and building business case presentations
Building CI/CD pipelines and working closely with Data Engineers
Deploying ML solutions in Vertex AI (GCP)
Managing project milestones and presenting progress and outcomes to leadership




Your Skills

Minimum of 5 years of experience in Data science and Machine learning
Expert in Python and SQL
Solid experience with Git, CI/CD pipelines
Understanding of Airflow, Terraform
Strong business acumen: ability to turn data into business decisions
Comfortable presenting results to non-technical stakeholders
Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform and Vertex AI preferred
Experience with Generative AI in production settings is a big plus
Proficiency in English mandatory (C1 minimum)




Your Background

Master's degree (or higher) in Software Engineering or equivalent
PhD is a plus but not mandatory




If you're passionate about applied AI, enjoy working closely with business teams, and want to deploy impactful models into production, we‚Äôd love to hear from you !




üì© Apply directly if you are interessted !




Please note that strong proficiency in English, at least five years of relevant experience, and EU citizenship (as required by Swiss regulations) are essential for this position. Unfortunately, applications not meeting these criteria cannot be considered.




#datascience #machinelearning #vertexai #generativeai #hiring #geneva #gcp #python #recommendersystems #mlengineer #ci_cd

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Are you passionate about AI and eager to drive innovation in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment? Do you have experience developing AI-powered applications and enjoy mentoring others? If so, we invite you to join Nexthink as an AI & ML Engineer!

As a key member of our AI team, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance digital employee experiences for millions worldwide.

Responsibilities


Lead AI Development ‚Äì Design and implement AI-powered products, with a strong focus on Agentic systems.
LLMs done right ‚Äì Create evaluations and define metrics of success using cutting edge AI platforms.
MLOps - Implement and manage MLOps practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of models and in production environments.
Collaboration & Leadership ‚Äì Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to align AI capabilities with business needs.
Mentorship & Coaching ‚Äì Guide and support junior AI engineers, fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing


Qualifications


BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Hands-on experience in LLM-powered production applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, PyTorch).
Proven experience with AWS and cloud-based AI deployments.
Solid understanding of AI model fine-tuning, optimization, and evaluation.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and multi-agent AI architectures.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs
Familiarity with MLOps best practices for deploying and monitoring AI models in production.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Eagerness to learn and adapt
Strong communication skills in English, capable of explaining complex AI concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing.


If you‚Äôre excited about pushing the boundaries of AI and mentoring the next generation of engineers, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Even if you don‚Äôt meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply‚Äîwe value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers‚Äô IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‚ÄòNexthinkers‚Äô and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

HTML:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Are you passionate about AI and eager to drive innovation in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment? Do you have experience developing AI-powered applications and enjoy mentoring others? If so, we invite you to join Nexthink as an AI & ML Engineer!

As a key member of our AI team, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance digital employee experiences for millions worldwide.

Responsibilities

  • Lead AI Development ‚Äì Design and implement AI-powered products, with a strong focus on Agentic systems.
  • LLMs done right ‚Äì Create evaluations and define metrics of success using cutting edge AI platforms.
  • MLOps - Implement and manage MLOps practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of models and in production environments.
  • Collaboration & Leadership ‚Äì Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to align AI capabilities with business needs.
  • Mentorship & Coaching ‚Äì Guide and support junior AI engineers, fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing

Qualifications

  • BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Hands-on experience in LLM-powered production applications.
  • Strong proficiency in Python and AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, PyTorch).
  • Proven experience with AWS and cloud-based AI deployments.
  • Solid understanding of AI model fine-tuning, optimization, and evaluation.
  • Knowledge of reinforcement learning, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and multi-agent AI architectures.
  • Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions
  • Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs
  • Familiarity with MLOps best practices for deploying and monitoring AI models in production.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt
  • Strong communication skills in English, capable of explaining complex AI concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing.

Title: Machine Learning, Data Science, and Software Development - Internship
Description:
Contexte et environnement

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

The Department of Modelling and Analysis for Trading Strategies at TotalEnergies Gas and Power leverages machine learning and algorithmic trading to deliver actionable insights to trading desks. Based in Geneva, the team operates in a dynamic environment influenced by evolving market trends, climate policies, and advancements in the energy sector. Focused on creating practical and lasting solutions, the team develops robust software products such as advanced Auto-ML libraries. With expertise in machine learning, data science, and software engineering, the team is committed to delivering impactful tools that drive innovation and efficiency.

This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a real-world setting, contributing to the company's goal of achieving Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Activit√©s

Activities:


Assist in the development of advanced AutoML time-series forecasting libraries tailored for trading, energy management, and optimization. Contribute to innovation in data science and machine learning through both applied development and research, exploring state-of-the-art methods to enhance forecasting accuracy and model robustness. Participate in software engineering challenges, code reviews, testing, and integration processes to ensure high-quality, production-ready solutions



Possible subjects of the internship include:


Double Machine Learning for causal inference in energy markets ‚Äî Conduct research on applying DML methods to estimate causal effects, improving decision-making and trading strategies through robust causal analysis.
Extension of AutoML capabilities for time-series forecasting ‚Äî Develop and test new modules to expand existing ML libraries, improving scalability, robustness, and user experience for applications in energy trading, management, and optimization.
Evaluation metrics research for forecasting models ‚Äî Investigate and define optimal KPIs for assessing time-series forecasting performance, focusing on practical relevance, interpretability, and measurable business impact.



Profil du candidat


Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field.
Strong interest in machine learning, data science, and software engineering.
A solid understanding of data science/machine learning principles and familiarity with software development, or strong software development skills with a working knowledge of data science and machine learning concepts.
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with ML libraries such as Scikit-learn, XGboost, TensorFlow, etc.
Eagerness to learn and innovate, with a proactive approach to problem-solving.



Fluency in English or French, with an advanced command of English required.

Informations suppl√©mentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversit√©, promeut le d√©veloppement individuel et offre des opportunit√©s d'emploi √©gales √† tous les candidats.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Sigma Suisse is seeking for it's client, a company in the trading sector, a Machine Learning Engineer :




Job Description :




Build and deploy machine learning systems addressing complex energy sector challenges

Partner with business teams to translate requirements into technical solutions

Implement AI capabilities (including LLMs) within existing infrastructure

Lead code quality initiatives and experimental framework design

Mentor colleagues in data science methodologies




Qualifications




Advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or quantitative field

3+ years hands-on experience building production ML systems

Expert-level Python programming with software engineering best practices

Proficiency in deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face)

Cloud computing experience (AWS) and containerization knowledge

Excellent analytical and stakeholder communication abilities




Background




Financial markets or commodity trading exposure

Dashboard development using visualization frameworks

Forecasting and econometric modeling expertise

Scalable system architecture experience

Workflow orchestration platforms knowledge

DevOps and automated deployment practices

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer




Essentials (please *don't apply* if you don't match all three):

You should have EU or Swiss nationality/C permit.
You should be top 5% both at your Bachelor and at your Master.
You should upload your full transcripts.




Role

You will work closely with our clients and project managers to design solutions, process data, train AI models, deploy models, and maintain them.
You will be involved in the full development process of AI products, to build the optimal solution for every situation.
You will collaborate and support our software engineers and infrastructure team to ensure smooth integration.
Your strong interpersonal skills will enable you to engage effectively with clients, both in-person and remotely.




Location

Lugano, min. 80% on site.

¬†

Required competence and attitudes

Strong programming skills (Python, SQL, ‚Ä¶) and knowledge of ML libraries (e.g. TensorFlow, Pytorch, Scikit-learn, ‚Ä¶).
In-depth knowledge of ML technologies, concepts and applications.
Expertise in data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Matplotlib, Power BI, ...).
Competences in deployment tools (Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD).
Familiarity with developing with Git (GitLab/Github/Bitbucket).
Experience with modern Python web frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask is a plus.
Expertise in system architecture, databases (e.g. PostgreSQL), cloud computing (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
Strong¬†communication and collaboration skills
Work experience is a plus.

¬†

Education

Top 5% Master‚Äôs degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Informatics, Engineering, or equivalent.




Languages

English: Strong command.
Strong command of Italian or German; French is a plus.




We offer

Full-time permanent contract.
Fast career development, attractive compensation.
Stimulating scientific context and informal environment.
Training, tutoring, and close relationship with cutting-edge research teams.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol‚Äôs customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

As our portfolio of work continues to grow, we are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our data science and machine learning team. The individual will work closely with the data and machine learning specialists, software engineers and commercial teams to deliver machine learning models and applications.

We work across the trading business, operations, and other support functions; so the individual will need to be comfortable working with a variety of stakeholders and technologies.

The Machine Learning Engineer at Vitol has visibility and impact across the full project workflow: from working with business stakeholders to help define the project, to data collation and processing, exploratory analysis, model selection and tuning, and implementation of production models.

The successful candidate will join a team of experienced, collaborative practitioners, who are (pragmatically) solving some of the most challenging and impactful problems the energy industry is facing; as well as pushing the boundaries around the ‚Äòart of the possible‚Äô.

Core Responsibilities Include


Being an energetic and enthusiastic member of a team uniquely positioned to bring the power of data to bear on the inner workings of the energy industry
Leading design, development, and deployment of machine learning systems, bringing their technical knowledge and experience into the team, and using this to create real solutions to real problems
Collaborating with cross-functional technology teams to gather requirements and ensure the solutions align with business objectives
Helping integrate the team‚Äôs solutions (including generative AI) into existing systems and platforms to provide seamless user experiences and scale adoption
Actively participating in code reviews, experiment design and tooling decisions to help drive the team‚Äôs velocity and quality
Helping build data and machine learning expertise within the business through knowledge sharing


Qualifications


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. Ph.D. is a plus
Fluency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code as well as a solid understanding of coding best practices
3-5+ years in industry developing and deploying machine learning models
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Transformers
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS) and containerization technologies (Docker)
Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to work independently and in a team
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Understanding of machine learning fundamentals, including deep learning, generative models, NLP techniques, etc.


Desired Experience


Experience in the energy or commodities trading industry, with knowledge of financial markets and trading concepts
Experience integrating machine learning systems into interactive dashboards (e.g. Dash, Streamlit) and present use cases of machine learning to non-technical colleagues
Time series modelling (both machine-learning and econometric approaches)
Application of a wide range of ML methodologies to real life applications
Enterprise software development (systems design, code review, version control, etc.)
Data orchestrators (Airflow, Dagster) and cloud-based ETL/ELT pipelines
Awareness of continuous integration and delivery concepts/technologies


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


A self-motivated individual who thrives on seeing the results of their work make an impact in the business
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Proven ability to be flexible, work hard, and a sense for the art of the possible
Methodical, organized and with an attention to detail - in general, in experimental design, and in code!
Willingness to share their knowledge and learn from others
An interest in learning about the commodities space
Resourceful, able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic environment
Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of integrity
Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world‚Äôs energy flows


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol‚Äôs operations
